V atómovom bunkri objavili milión kanibalistických mravcov. Ich trápenie ukončili vedci
Prírodovedci sa rozhodli mravcom pomôcť a v bunkri nainštalovali drevenú tyč, po ktorej sa mohli vyštverať na povrch.
06 Nov 2019, 10:28 by TEMPLEWO/kc
Aj keď sa ocitli na nehostinnom mieste, našli spôsob ako prežiť. Mravce v bývalej raketovej základni v Poľsku vedcov prekvapili svojou prispôsobivosťou.
Betónový kolos, ktorý postavil Sovietsky zväz v lesoch pri dedine Templewo, dlhé roky chátral. Zvedavci ho začali navštevovať od roku 2010. Išlo najmä o prírodovedcov, ktorí sledovali miestnu kolóniu netopierov.
Popritom si však všimli niečo oveľa zaujímavejšie - kolóniu mravcov s veľmi atypickým správaním.


Ventilačná šachta, cez torú mravce popadali do bunkra. Foto: Rutkowski et al., Journal of Hymenoptera Research, 2019  

Mravce lesné (formica polyctena) sa v chladom hrdzavom bunkri bez svetla a potravy ocitli nešťastnou náhodou. Mravenisko si totiž postavili hneď vedľa vetracej šachty, do ktorej postupne popadali pri hľadaní potravy. Píše sa v štúdii.
Keď v roku 2013 nezvyčajnú kolóniu objavili, odhadli počet mravcov na milión jedincov. Mravce sa z bunkra nevedeli dostať na povrch, zostali tam uväznené bez kráľovnej a jediným zdrojom potravy boli mŕtve netopiere alebo myši.
Nedostatok jedla a neschopnosť sa rozmnožovať, však rast kolónie nezastavil, mravce sa totiž uchýlili ku kanibalizmu. Biológovia v okolí mraveniska našli pozostatky až troch miliónov mravcov. Drvivá väčšina z nich mala na telách stopy po mravčích hryzadlách.
Prírodovedci sa rozhodli mravcom pomôcť a v bunkri nainštalovali drevenú tyč, po ktorej sa mohli vyštverať na povrch. Po pár mesiacoch izolovaná kolónia zmizla - všetky mravce sa vrátili do lesa.


Tyč, po ktorej mravce vyliezli z bunkra. Foto: Rutkowski et al., Journal of Hymenoptera Research, 2019

They discovered a million cannibalistic ants in an atomic bunker. Their suffering ended the scientists
The naturalists decided to help the ants and installed a wooden stick in the bunker, after which they could spur to the surface.
06 Nov 2019, 10:28 by TEMPLEWO
Even in a hostile place, they found a way to survive. The ants at the former missile base in Poland surprised scientists with their adaptability.
The concrete colossus built by the Soviet Union in the woods at Templewo village has been decaying for many years. Critics began to visit it since 2010. It was mainly naturalists who followed the local colony of bats.
At the same time, however, they noticed something more interesting - a colony of ants with very atypical behavior.


The ventilation shaft, through the ants, fell into the bunker. Photo: Rutkowski et al., Journal of Hymenoptera Research, 2019

Wood ants (formica polyctena) found themselves in a cold rusty bunker without light and food by accident. The anthill was built next to the ventilation shaft, which gradually fell into the search for food. It is written in the study.
When they discovered an unusual colony in 2013, they estimated the number of ants per million individuals. The ants couldn't get out of the bunker, they were trapped there without the queen, and the only food sources were dead bats or mice.
Lack of food and inability to reproduce, but the growth of the colony did not stop, because the ants resorted to cannibalism. Biologists around the anthill have found the remains of up to three million ants. The vast majority of them showed signs of ants on their bodies.
The naturalists decided to help the ants and installed a wooden stick in the bunker, after which they could spur to the surface. After a few months the isolated colony had disappeared - all the ants had returned to the forest.


The rod the ants climbed out of the bunker. Photo: Rutkowski et al., Journal of Hymenoptera Research, 2019
